Eli Miller.Action: Mom soothes Eli during his breathing difficulty with gentle words and practiced breathing exercises.
Eli is shown in a vulnerable state, struggling with his breathing and fear from nightmares.
Follows breathing technique as taught by Mom to calm down during an asthma attack or panic episode.
Looks around frantically and panics when struggling to breathe.
Uses a tried and true breathing technique to calm himself successfully.
Washes up carefully with antibacterial wipes, brushes teeth using bottled water, and changes into a vacuum-sealed fresh T-shirt before putting on his germ-free suit.
Responds verbally 'Fire' and 'I'm fine' despite clearly being far from okay.
Gives his Dad a thumbs up despite nervousness
Quietly zips himself up in cumbersome suit and signals gently to Mom
Freezes and hesitates before leaving motel room, looking frightened
Calms himself by doing breathing exercises when nervous.
Ignores parental requests to lower the music volume.
Continues diligently working on his drawing despite distractions.
Does not respond when asked how he is feeling.
Hesitates and is scared to enter the decontamination chamber, needing encouragement from his parents before stepping inside.
Complies with the instructions to enter and endure the decontamination process despite fear and being startled, ultimately progressing forward.
Rushes to his parents' side and grabs onto them, showing gratitude and affection.
Expresses concern about safety, showing sincerity and openness.
Laughs and enjoys his parents' affectionate hugs despite initial hesitation.
Gratefully rushes to his parents' side and holds on to them for reassurance.
Expresses concern about safety by asking, 'What if it isn’t safe?'
Carefully removes his suit and helmet with trepidation, then calmly breathes the new air several times.
Laughs and plays along with his mom’s affection without resistance or discomfort.
Takes the rest of the suit off and relaxes a bit.
Walks up to the cemented-over fireplace and notices detail of the gold crucifix, showing attentiveness to surroundings.
Yells at Dr. Horn to close the drapes, showing fear and distrust but also expressing his feelings honestly.
Refuses to try the shower water despite encouragement, showing vulnerability rather than resistance.
Overcomes initial fear to try new experiences like showering alone and responds to his environment with curiosity and experimentation (testing the echo, playing with sounds).
Pauses to think carefully before agreeing to wash alone, indicating thoughtful consideration of new situations.
Shows vulnerability and frustration with a primal scream but recovers quickly and accepts the lack of response from the environment.
Shrugs off the missing echo and proceeds, showing adaptability and emotional regulation.
Obeys Dr. Horn's instructions promptly and correctly, flipping onto his stomach as requested.
Feels nervous and uncomfortable but attempts to maintain composure during medical procedure.
Grips Mom's hand tightly out of fear and pain, showing vulnerability rather than confidence.
Keeps counting down steadily despite pain and grogginess from medication.
Draws curtains slightly to listen to outside sound and then opens them cautiously to observe surroundings.
Experiences disorientation and pain after procedure, showing physical vulnerability but still manages basic self-care like checking his injury and moving around.
Startles and jumps back when the tadpole hits the window, then bumbles through an excuse.
Becomes transfixed and curious about the tadpole, asks informed questions about it.
Shifts uncomfortably and hesitates when invited outdoors, showing social discomfort.
Effectively explains his complicated health condition and backstory when asked, showing thoughtful communication.
Screams for help frantically, seeks out Mom and Dad in panic, hides behind Mom when adults ask questions.
Denies responsibility for the trashed room despite confusion.
Races through the house with panic and fear, screaming and wheezing but showing confusion about his surroundings and hallucination.
Tries to seek help by calling out to Mom and Dad repeatedly while in distress.
Hides behind Mom in the hallway instead of confronting or explaining the situation confidently.
Expresses confusion honestly about how his room got trashed and denies responsibility.
Stares back at the mess, uncertain if it was real
Shares nightmares openly with Dr. Horn despite discomfort
Communicates clearly about his nightmares when encouraged, shows self-awareness about his feelings and experiences.
Appears uncertain whether the events he witnessed actually happened or were imagined, indicating some confusion.
Squeezes Mom’s hand nervously during medical procedure.
Turns away quickly, shaking but trying to contain fear.
Tries to use breathing technique as instructed to manage pain.
Fails to accept Dad's offered hand for support, clings tightly to Mom's hand causing her pain.
Eli screams when startled by Haley popping up unexpectedly.
Eli tries to share his vision of the dog with Haley, showing a desire to connect and be believed.
Eli watches Haley with cold fascination, forgetting his vision momentarily.
Eli reacts with surprise and mild disgust to the mosquito popping and blood splattering, showing realistic but not hostile response.
Is startled and screams when surprised by Haley popping up suddenly.
Questions reality and his own perception when unsure if he actually saw the dog.
Asks Haley about what she is doing and watches her demonstrate a mosquito trick with cold fascination.
Sings a gentle, comforting song 'You are my sunshine' softly
Attempts to communicate urgency about leaving despite weakness
Weak and dazed, yet still tries to connect with parents by saying 'Mom? Dad?'
Recognizes danger and insists they have to leave immediately despite his weak state.
Speaks weakly and is dazed, showing physical and mental exhaustion.
Fails to effectively communicate or convince others of the urgency of leaving.
Tries to explain his fear and experience despite being disbelieved by his parents; insists they believe him.
Becomes indignant and bangs his fist on the medical bench out of frustration.
Clearly communicates his perceptions and concerns about the haunting despite disbelief from others.
Becomes visibly upset and bangs his fist, losing composure during the conversation.
Shares a personal and somewhat vulnerable belief about the house being haunted and seeks Haley's belief and support.
Expresses frustration towards Dr. Horn by calling her a liar in front of his parents.
Argues passionately with parents about Haley, becomes frustrated and slams fist on glass table, injuring hand unintentionally.
Accepts the sleeping pill without resistance from Dr. Horn.
Insists on his perspective about seeing ghosts and tries to convince his parents.
Becomes overwhelmed by emotions and rage, slams fist onto glass table causing injury.
Accepts medical treatment calmly and cooperates with Dr. Horn, taking the sleeping pill without resistance.
Refuses to take the sleeping pill and flushes it down the toilet, showing control and intentionality.
Sneaks quietly down the hallway and listens in on the adults' conversation, demonstrating stealth and observational skills.
Darts behind the wall when noticed, showing quick reaction and caution.
Observes family tension silently, feeling emotional but not expressing it outwardly.
Closes his door quietly at night, retreating inward rather than seeking support.
Watches his parents carefully, processes situation silently with a steeled face.
Quietly closes his door to avoid being overheard, tries to keep to himself.
Uses his iPad as a flashlight to investigate a noise under the bed calmly despite being scared.
Initially startled and spooked by noises under his bed, showing fear and uncertainty.
Falls scared to the floor when startled by the Dead Boy, scrambles backward in fear.
After close call with bed falling, gathers himself and notices the carved number 5166 above him, showing attention and reflection.
Realizes the danger in time and leaps off the bed racing for the door to escape.
Startles and falls to the floor upon seeing the Dead Boy, then scrambles backward.
Survives the bed falling on him by quickly positioning himself underneath it, using the broken iPad as life-saving buffer.
Pauses briefly to notice the carved number above him, indicating alertness and observation even under stress.
Does not attempt to confront or outsmart the Dead Boy directly, instead focused only on escape and survival.
Trails off and chooses to lie about the broken iPad instead of telling the truth.
Shows vulnerability and internal struggle about telling the truth to his mother.
Endures painful gene treatment while parents comfort him.
Figures out that the numbers hidden under his bed are a code related to Dr. Horn’s wing.
Decides to test the code at night after everyone goes to sleep, demonstrating strategic planning and courage.
Waits until late night, prepares carefully, and takes precautions like alerting Haley to not get caught.
Carefully and patiently tries to open the locked drawer using a letter opener he found, showing ingenuity and respect for property by not breaking it.
Smiles, pleased with himself after successfully opening the drawer.
Scrambles to pick up the spilled folders and carefully arranges them before hiding.
Hides under the desk silently when caught off guard.
Quietly hides to avoid being found by Dr. Horn, carefully protects evidence of his hiding place by locking drawer with letter opener.
Shares secrets about Dr. Horn’s true nature and the danger he faces with Haley, showing trust and openness.
Shushes Haley to keep calm and maintain secrecy despite the danger, signaling protective behavior.
Struggles violently to avoid treatment, yells and fights being restrained.
Bites his dad to escape and prevent being injected with a harmful substance, aggressively defends himself.
Eavesdrops on mom and Dr. Horn's conversation outside his door.
Bites down hard on Dad's arm to free himself from being held down.
Shoves Dr. Horn with all his strength, causing her to lose control of the syringe and break the bottle.
Eavesdrops on the conversation between his mom and Dr. Horn to gain information.
Fails to interpret the implications of Dr. Horn changing the door code immediately.
Plea for help with sincere desperation, quietly opens door despite fear
Examines surroundings carefully, respects presence of ghost rather than acting rashly
Pursues the truth by opening the old chest despite discomfort, showing courage and determination.
Calls out to the person he thinks is Dr. Horn with concern and urgency.
Expresses confusion and concern when seeing his mom running towards him unexpectedly.
Pleading and begging his mother to open the door and let him out, showing vulnerability and trust.
Carefully opens the old chest slowly so as not to disturb dust particles.
Uses a flashlight to examine the contents of the dark chest, revealing the corpses inside.
Mistakes a figure running after him for Dr. Horn, but it is actually his mom, causing confusion.
Panics and pounds on the door to escape after his mom locks him in, inhaling dust and showing signs of distress.
Uses the last of his energy to plead with Dad for help while trapped, showing vulnerability and trust.
Remains silent when Dr. Horn calls, possibly indicating distrust or resignation.
Feigns unconsciousness to ambush Dr. Horn and violently attacks her with a bone from a corpse.
Comes up with idea to use the chest and bones in his escape attempt.
Performs a convincing fake unconsciousness to trick Dr. Horn.
Successfully disarms and attacks Dr. Horn using a femur bone.
Drives Dr. Horn unconscious with a femur bone weapon, demonstrating physical effectiveness and decisiveness.
Runs down the staircase quickly but noisily, alerting others to his movement.
Acts with urgency and speed to escape, showing decisiveness and focus on the goal.
Fails to detect or anticipate Dad grabbing him from behind, allowing himself to be intercepted.
Uses the armoire as an improvised weapon/trap, showing strategic thinking and situational awareness.
Perry opens the door for Eli, showing he is not alone and has allies; Eli runs to escape danger aggressively using objects around him to block Dad.
Eli struggles desperately to break the window to escape, showing determination but no interaction with others beyond urgency.
Uses momentum and a bone-club to repeatedly smash the window attempting to escape.
Blocks the door with a dresser to prevent Dad from entering.
Continues to try breaking the window despite making little progress and losing energy.
Tells Haley to leave to keep her safe despite her protests, shows care and protectiveness.
Speaks severely and insists Haley go despite her emotional reaction.
Stops fighting or protecting himself as defeat becomes inevitable, indicating resignation rather than warmth or cruelty.
Snaps Dr. Horn’s wrist violently, strangles her, and shows no hesitation causing pain and fear.
Smiles coldly after harming Dr. Horn and expresses desire to continue aggression.
Drops Dr. Horn’s lifeless body without remorse.
Questions his parents intensely and angrily, seeking truth about his identity.
Effortlessly disarms Dr. Horn by snapping her wrist and overpowering her physically.
Creates and controls a threatening environment by causing the room to explode into flames behind him.
Maintains calm and confidence even when his parents enter and confront him.
Purposefully kills Dr. Horn and shows no hesitation or uncertainty in his actions.
Allows Haley to toss him a tadpole, studies it with fascination
Squashes the tadpole in his fist
Greets Haley with a simple 'Hi' and responds openly
Shows no visible remorse or emotional warmth after killing three people and the burning of his house
Steps outside calmly after a traumatic event, breathes fresh air, and engages in a composed conversation with Haley.
Catches an object thrown to him, observes it closely, then decisively squashes the tadpole, showing decisiveness and self-control.
Opens his eyes with intensity and red coloring after emotional distress, suggesting emotional turmoil but also focus.
Shows no surprise when seeing Haley waiting, despite recent violent actions, indicating emotional or social detachment.
Eli doesn’t react to seeing his deceased parents as ghosts under his control.
Takes Haley's hand and walks with her to enjoy the fresh air despite the unsettling surroundings.
Responds to Dad's question calmly and reassures him by saying 'I’m fine' despite his face showing distress.
Throws colored pencil in frustration after it breaks, showing irritation but no aggression toward others.
Dismisses Mom’s concern with a short 'Fine' and shrugs apathetically, indicating emotional distance or unfriendliness.
Cuts off Mom before she can continue talking, showing reluctance to engage openly.
Notices the little girl nearby and puts down his iPad, showing potential interest or awareness of others.
Stares incredulously up at the house through the window, showing awareness and processing the new environment.
Walks up to the path with great trepidation, staying wedged between Mom and Dad, indicating hesitation and lack of confidence facing the new situation.
Clings to Mom, shows fear and hesitation entering the decontamination chamber.
Walks around the house and observes the rooms quietly, without complaint or negativity.
Expresses dislike for mushrooms and reluctance to follow the diet prescribed by Dr. Horn.
Passively accepts the situation (new room, new diet) without showing initiative or confidence.
Shows fear and withdraws when confronted with the window and sunlight, indicating difficulty coping with the environment.
Holds hands with Mom and smiles at her while experiencing the warmth of running water together.
Allows himself to relax and enjoy a peaceful moment in the shower, showing trust in the adults around him.
Plays with the echo in his empty room and has fun, showing openness and a lighthearted side.
Screams out frustration loudly but then accepts the silence without anger or blame, suggesting emotional regulation and tolerance.
Shows nervousness before meeting Dr. Horn, questions what will happen.
Follows directions to the exam room, sits cooperatively despite some resistance.
Flips the switch to let outside sounds in and draws drapes to peek at the little neighbor girl playing outside, showing interest in his surroundings and connection to others.
Shows no immediate interaction or attempt to communicate with the little girl despite hearing her voice and curiosity.
Darts behind the drapes, embarrassed when caught staring.
Does nothing and stays frozen when someone knocks and taunts him at the window, too scared to respond immediately.
Pulls back the drapes and apologizes when the girl threatens to tell her daddy, engaging verbally to de-escalate.
Takes a nervous beat but steps closer to the window nonetheless, showing a willingness to confront fear rather than appear cowardly.
Becomes transfixed by the tadpole and shows genuine curiosity.
Feels uncomfortable and bumbles an excuse when teased about being scared.
Opens up about his medical condition and personal history to Haley.
Responds gently when Haley apologizes for being tactless about his illness.
Engages in light joking with Haley, making her smile and sharing a moment of connection.
Stays quietly reflective after Haley leaves without saying goodbye.
Uses humor to engage and create rapport with Haley despite his limited social experience.
Openly admits his limitations regarding outdoor experience and social interaction.
Shows internal discomfort and uncertainty during social exchange with Haley.
Stays alone and cautiously moves through a dark hallway, demonstrating alertness and calm in a potentially unsettling situation.
Asks if Haley might be able to come over, showing desire for social connection.
Does not argue harshly or lash out despite disappointment and restrictive environment.
Slides bowl away, refuses food, expresses sadness and frustration internally.
Eli asks if Haley might come over, showing hopeful initiative in social engagement despite illness.
Eli pushes the bowl of gruel away and says he’s not hungry, showing awareness of his own condition and preferences but possibly a lack of acceptance or compliance.
Eli eavesdrops quietly and carefully walks backwards without making a sound, demonstrating stealth and situational awareness.
Eli shows signs of doubt and worry about not getting better, indicating emotional vulnerability and lack of confidence at the moment.
Leaves the scene quietly when his parents argue, showing respect for their privacy and avoiding conflict.
Closes the drapes to shut himself off from the outside world, indicating withdrawal or detachment.
Carefully eavesdrops and stealthily walks backwards without making a sound, peeks around the corner.
Leaves the room when his parents argue without making an intervention, unnoticed by them.
Pauses reading to shut the drapes and close himself off from the outside world, showing situational awareness.
Wakes up disoriented, notices fire, and despite pain from his bad leg, manages to get up and escape.
Falls backward hitting his bad leg when surprised by the fire, indicating some temporary physical limitation or vulnerability.
Acknowledges his nervousness but stays composed during the medical procedure, squeezing his mom's hand for support rather than panic.
Struggles to understand the explanation about his sleepwalking and gene treatment but admits it with 'I guess so' instead of pretending to understand or shutting down.
Turns away from the syringe and visibly shakes, indicating fear and discomfort.
Squeezes Mom’s hand tightly despite hurting her, showing reliance and trust.
Does not take Dad’s hand, refuses to share comfort with him in moment of pain.
Cries openly and receives comfort from parents, showing vulnerability and sincerity.
Looks out for something unusual (the boy in tatters) and tries to alert his parents despite their skepticism.
Shows fear and vulnerability openly to his parents.
Persists in expressing his concern despite being dismissed, demonstrating sincerity.
Stops and freezes when he sees the boy in tattered clothes, physically reacting with adrenaline to a perceived threat.
Attempts to communicate his observation to his parents despite their skepticism, showing persistence and situational awareness.
Fails to convince his parents of what he saw, resulting in being dismissed and not taken seriously.
Unable to calm himself down and fall asleep due to adrenaline and open drapes, indicating difficulty in emotional self-regulation at this moment.
Surveys the outside from his window thoughtfully, noticing the dog from his dream, showing attentive observation and connection-making.
Calls out anxiously for his mom and dad, tries to escape the chamber and seeks help.
Hurries out of bed and follows Mom immediately after sensing something is wrong.
Approaches the decontamination chamber threshold cautiously, not wanting to cross it.
Screams and scrambles to escape when trapped, banging on the door and calling for help.
Does not know the code to unlock the door to exit the chamber.
Attempts to leave the house despite danger, struggling to put on protective suit.
Is cared for tenderly by Mom, Dad, and Dr. Horn; Eli remains passive and dependent in this moment.
Forces himself to move towards his Germ-Suit despite extreme physical distress and panic.
Struggles in panic to get the Germ-Suit from the hanger, causing delay and difficulty.
Attempts to put on the Germ-Suit under life-threatening conditions.
Despite his efforts, collapses and nearly passes out, requiring rescue.
Insists to his parents that the house is haunted despite expert advice to the contrary, showing persistence in expressing his genuine feelings.
Does not engage with Haley’s attempt to play tic-tac-toe, appearing lost in thought and unresponsive to her friendly gesture.
Questions Dr. Horn’s explanation and insists on the reality of his experience despite authoritative denial.
Fails to persuade his parents or others of his point of view, appears not confident in communication.
Gets distracted and lost in thought, showing difficulty focusing.
Shares a sensitive or unusual observation (believes the house is haunted) despite risk of disbelief or ridicule.
Persists in seeking confirmation and validation from Haley, showing initiative and critical thinking.
Disregards authority (Dr. Horn) by calling her a liar based on circumstantial evidence.
Hesitates to tell the truth about breaking the iPad, then admits it was an accident.
Observes Dr. Horn entering the locked room by noting the keypad code.
Undergoes a painful gene treatment with visible distress and no signs of control or coping.
Creeps up the stairs carefully, uses flashlight to navigate in darkness.
Carefully enters the code slowly and successfully unlocks the door, showing ability to handle pressure.
Freezes audibly after unlocking door but then gathers courage to proceed inside.
Quietly explores the wing, cautiously inspects rooms and medical cabinet, thorough and attentive.
Hesitates momentarily before entering but does not retreat.
Conceals himself carefully under the desk to avoid detection by Dr. Horn, uses the letter opener to lock the drawer stealthily before she can see him.
Paces anxiously and discusses with Haley the dangers of the treatments and his own situation, showing awareness but hesitancy to act immediately.
Snaps at Mom to shut off the lights and go away when she shows concern.
Does not respond to Mom's reassurance that they are there for him.
Tries to comfort himself by saying 'It's okay. They don’t want to hurt you.'
Despite fear, does not run away from the ghost and prepares to confront the closet.
Snaps at Mom to keep the lights off and insists he’s busy, showing clear communication of his boundaries.
Despite fear and startled reaction to the ghost on the ceiling, he does not run away and instead keeps his flashlight trained carefully on the closet.
Attempts to calm himself with deep breaths before opening the closet door, demonstrating presence of mind under stress.
Holds hand on doorknob hesitantly and tenses up before opening, showing uncertainty and nervousness.
Checks thoroughly for clues after the bookcase moves, speaks sincerely trying to understand.
Screams and falls backwards out of fear when surprised by ghosts.
Accidentally hits his mom and immediately shows shock and concern.
Refuses to see Dr. Horn despite concern from parents and doctor, pushing them away out of fear.
Keeps parents together and close, using them as a barrier, showing implicit trust and seeking protection from family.
Recognizes something important in the library after a stressful moment, indicating awareness and a moment of insight.
Refuses to cooperate with Dr. Horn's exam, acting out of fear rather than calm confidence.
Uses Mom and Dad as a barrier between himself and Dr. Horn, showing avoidance rather than assertive problem-solving.
Talks to himself and possibly to The Ghosts, expressing frustration.
Frantically searches the library, tearing down books without regard for noise or mess.
Looks around to ensure the coast is clear before entering the wing.
Chooses to search a desk where he had previous luck, showing strategic thinking.
Systematically checks all drawers for secrets but finds none.
Grows antsy and frustrated as he fails to find anything, showing signs of losing composure.
Walks the perimeter of the bookcases scanning for clues despite uncertainty.
Manically tears books off the shelves, making noise and risking being caught.
Gives up on the plan after the code change and says there's nothing he can do.
Refuses help and lashes out aggressively at Haley, showing a loss of self-control and irrational behavior.
Eventually apologizes and acknowledges his loss of control, showing some self-awareness.
Manages a brief smile to help Haley feel better.
Carefully and quietly tries to move around without waking his parents, showing consideration.
Enters a dangerous unknown hallway despite fear, pushes forward instead of retreating.
Covers face and hesitates in fear but then uses available resources (t-shirt as mask) to protect himself and proceeds.
Does not know the technical term for the symbol (Ouroboros) he finds.
Turns off flashlight to rely on room light, suggesting adaptability and situational awareness.
Speaks aloud to himself, maybe indicating uncertainty or hesitation.
Uses the rest of his energy to plead for help despite struggling to breathe.
Attempts to escape by banging on the door but fails as it remains locked.
After regaining consciousness, assesses surroundings and tests the door again.
Creates distance between himself and approaching footsteps, showing situational awareness.
Remains silent when Dr. Horn calls to him despite having opportunity to respond.
Expresses intense anger and accuses his parents of lying and trying to kill him, screams at the door.
Draws a picture of Haley in the dust and refers to The Ghosts as almost friends.
Runs away from a violent situation without checking on the victim or trying to help.
Ignores his mother's calls and warnings while fleeing.
Acts wildly and threateningly with a bone-club in hand, appearing aggressive and untrustworthy.
Recognizes the danger quickly and urges Haley to leave to protect her, showing clear-headedness and situational awareness.
Stays calm and authoritative despite the threat and imminent danger, issuing direct orders to Haley.
Smashes the bone against the window as a decisive action to try to create an escape or buy time.
Drops the bone initially, showing momentary defeat or exhaustion.
Forces Haley to leave by shouting and smashing a bone against the window, causing her to flee frightened.
Desperately pleads with Dr. Horn not to restrain him, showing vulnerability and genuine fear.
Accuses Dr. Horn of poisoning him and expresses anger toward her actions.
Commands Haley firmly to leave, using physical action to reinforce authority.
Struggles vigorously against restraints and attempts to break free despite being physically overpowered.
Plea and emotional outbursts toward Dr. Horn show desperation but lack control of the situation.
Accurately accuses Dr. Horn of deceit and poisoning, indicating awareness and insight.
Unable to prevent being restrained and locked in, showing a lack of ability to avoid capture.
Continues to struggle and protests he is not sick despite the harsh treatment.
Grips Dr. Horn’s wrist to stop her from stabbing him despite his fear.
Admits plainly and calmly, 'It’s been me the whole time. I’m the problem.'
Breaks free from restraints using unexpected strength and grip, overpowering Dr. Horn.
Remains calm and speaks with clarity and insight after breaking free, indicating self-awareness of the true problem.
Initially shows confusion and terror before regaining composure and revealing knowledge beyond his years.
Does not resist when Mom takes his hand, allowing closeness and connection.
Stares back with a hint of humanity while parents express love and hope.
Looks away, unable to face parents' desperation and love, holds back tears.
Eli spots his deceased parents as ghosts and recognizes they are under his rule, but he doesn’t react emotionally.
Eli calmly accepts Haley’s guidance and takes her hand to move forward despite the surreal and intense situation.
